intro: Chomelia gilletii, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its striking yellow, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. Chomelia gilletii typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture, while its stems are woody and somewhat branched.
